hedline.hl1: Now You Can Rent A Movie at 35,000 Feet

abstract.p: InMotion Pictures opens kiosks in several airports where, for $10 a day, travelers can rent battery-powered, laptop-size DVD player with movie, headset and extra battery; movies alone are available for $5 each (S)

block.p: Bored airline passengers have a new way to help pass the time when they find themselves stuck in an airport because of delays or a long layover.

They can rent a portable DVD player and watch a movie. Frequent fliers who have seen just about every in-flight movie can watch the film of their choice, and children can be entertained with movies appropriate to their ages.
Bored airline passengers have a new way to help pass the time when they find themselves stuck in an airport because of delays or a long layover.

They can rent a portable DVD player and watch a movie. Frequent fliers who have seen just about every in-flight movie can watch the film of their choice, and children can be entertained with movies appropriate to their ages.

InMotion Pictures has opened kiosks in seven airports, where for $10 a day travelers can rent a battery-powered DVD player with movie, headset and extra battery. Additional movies rent for $4 and extra headsets are $2.50.
The laptop-size DVD players fall under the same in-flight rules that apply to other electronic equipment like computers and cassette players.

One-way rentals are available if the destination airport has an InMotion kiosk. Multiple-day rentals include additional movies -- one for each day. Travelers with their own portable DVD players or people whose laptop computers have DVD capability can rent just the movie disk for $5 and return the disk by prepaid mailer within five days.

About 200 movie titles, including children's films, classics and new releases, are available at InMotion kiosks at the airports in Denver; Minneapolis-St. Paul; Philadelphia; Portland, Ore.; Seattle-Tacoma; San Diego; and San Jose, Calif. The company expects to open in La Guardia Airport as well as in Atlanta, Cincinnati, Orlando, San Francisco and Jacksonville, Fla., within the next several months.
Movies can be reserved at (877) 383-8646. More information is also available at www.inmotionpictures.com.
